ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned a lot about the western political canon.
This course was a wonderful introduction to modern political theory. The essay comments were helpful towards writing, and the book-a-week format was wonderful.
A strong basis in the critical texts that guided the development of contemporary political thought. I learned how to write papers and read books efficiently.
I gained working knowledge of the key political theorists we covered. My writing greatly improved, as did my ability to generate nuanced ideas about the texts.
I improved at writing and historical analysis!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: Great prof, strong syllabus,excellent feedback on papers (Prof Semmel goes through great care; most feedback I have ever received on paper and writing mechanics),  very chill classroom environment.

Weakness: discussions sometimes was lacking; maybe more open questions for a better discussion.
Not much to criticize. Its a good course.

Strengths: format, reading selection, seminar
Weakness: Some of the lectures, but not most, were somewhat tangential to the actual reading

Strengths: exposure to wide number of interesting books, format is conducive to knowing your peers and professors better, great lectures
Weaknesses: lack depth in understanding on most of them, its difficult to finish all the readings, there's not so much feedback from professors to the students in general.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Maybe. Its a big commitment but very rewarding.
Yes. DS H&P is a wonderful course for learning important works.

Yes! DS is great. H&P is my fav section (mostly the texts are just sooo good).  I would recommend a different prof though. Prof Semmel is super nice and caring, but he doesn't have such a great command of the seminar. His questions are too narrow and not conducive to fruitful class discussion.

Yes. The political thinkers we read this semester have already been useful to me in conversation and study. They are must reads and there is no better time to read them than with the stellar DS professors.
